intro: Plicouratea bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored plicouratea, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking bi-colored leaves, which typically display a combination of green and white or yellow hues. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. Its foliage is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its aesthetic appeal. Plicouratea bicolor prefers humid, shaded environments and is relatively easy to care for in suitable conditions.
